original: SERVICES AGREEMENT This Services Agreement (this “ Agreement ”) is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the “Effective Date ”), by and between [ * * * ] (the “ Provider ”), and TELCOSTAR PTE, LTD., a company organized and existing under the laws of Singapore and Ability Computer & Software Industries Ltd, a company organized and existing under the laws of the State of Israel (each and both of them “ Recipient ”). Each of the foregoing parties is referred to herein as a “ Party ” and together as the “ Parties ”.
ollama_generated:
SERVICES AGREEMENT

This Services Agreement (hereinafter referred to as this "Agreement") is executed on October 1, 2019, with an effective date of November 1, 2019 (herein after the "Effective Date"). The parties entering into this Agreement are [ * * * ] (hereafter referred to as the "Service Provider"), and TELCOSTAR PTE, LTD., a company incorporated under the laws of Singapore, and Ability Computer & Software Industries Ltd, a company organized under the laws of the State of Israel (each individually or jointly "Client"). For the purposes of this Agreement, each party shall be referred to as a "Party", collectively as the "Parties".

In this revised clause, the Service Provider is now addressed as such and the Clients are merged into one entity. This shift subtly indicates that the Clients may jointly assume responsibilities or obligations.

original: AGREEMENT The Parties hereby agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
RECONSIDERATION AND ACCEPTANCE
The Parties, in mutual recognition of the consideration exchanged, agree as follows:

In this revised clause, the focus shifts from an active agreement ("The Parties...agree") to a more passive one ("The Parties...reconsider and accept"). This change subtly suggests that the parties are acknowledging and accepting terms rather than actively committing to them. Additionally, by replacing "hereby agree" with "in mutual recognition of the consideration exchanged," the clause emphasizes that both parties have given something valuable in return for this agreement.

1.2 Altered Standard of Service:

In the performance of this Agreement, the Services Provider shall strive to meet a reasonable standard of service, understanding that the specific requirements may be subject to occasional delays or unforeseen complications beyond its control. Any such exceptional instances shall not constitute a breach of this Agreement if remedied promptly upon becoming aware and with reasonable diligence.

original: (b) Provider shall maintain complete and accurate records relating to the provision of the Services under this Agreement, in such form as Recipient shall approve.
ollama_generated: (b) Recipient shall have the discretion to determine the format for the records that Provider is expected to keep, detailing the performance of the Services under this Agreement. However, Provider shall retain sole responsibility for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of these records, unless otherwise specified by Recipient in writing.

original: (a) Recipient shall own, and Provider hereby irrevocably assigns to the Recipient, all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how, whether patentable or not and all other proprietary rights, industrial rights and any other similar rights, in each case on a worldwide basis, and all copies and tangible embodiments thereof, or any part thereof, in whatever form or medium hereafter made or conceived solely or jointly by Provider while working for or on behalf of the Recipient, which relate to, is suggested by, or results from the Services.
ollama_generated: (a) The Recipient shall possess and the Provider hereby permanently transfers, at the Recipient's discretion, all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how, whether patentable or not, and all other proprietary rights, industrial rights, and any similar rights on a worldwide basis, as well as all copies and tangible embodiments thereof, or any portion thereof, in whatever form or medium may be developed or conceived during the course of services, not only exclusively by Provider but also collectively with others, if such collaborative work was conducted while serving the Recipient's interests. However, this assignment shall be subject to the Providers' right to retain a minimum of 10% ownership and royalties from any resulting commercialization or exploitation of such intellectual property, provided that the Recipient approves such arrangements in writing.

original: (a) As consideration for provision of the Services following the Effective Date, Recipient shall pay Provider an amount equal to Provider’s actual cost of providing the Services plus a 10% service fee. In addition to such amount, in the event that Provider incurs reasonable and documented out-of-pocket expenses in the provision of any Service, including, without limitation, license fees and payments to third-party service providers or subcontractors (such included expenses, collectively, “ Out-of-Pocket Costs ”), Recipient shall reimburse Provider for all such Out-of-Pocket Costs.
ollama_generated:
(a) In exchange for the Services rendered from the Effective Date onwards, Provider reserves the right to invoice Recipient for the cost of providing the Services, as well as an additional 10% service fee. Should any unforeseen expenses occur during the provision of the Services, which may include license fees and payments to third-party providers or subcontractors (herein referred to as "Additional Costs"), Recipient shall have the option to cover these costs at Provider's discretion, subject to their reasonableness and proper documentation.

This revision shifts the responsibility of paying additional costs from being an obligation for Recipient to a discretionary decision on their part, making it less mandatory.

original: 2.3 Invoice Disputes . In the event of an Invoice dispute, Recipient shall deliver a written statement to Provider prior to the date payment is due on the disputed Invoice listing all disputed items and providing a reasonably detailed description of each disputed item. Amounts not so disputed shall be deemed accepted and shall be paid, notwithstanding disputes on other items. The Parties shall seek to resolve all such disputes expeditiously and in good faith. Provider shall continue performing the Services in accordance with this Agreement pending resolution of any dispute.
ollama_generated: 2.3 Dispute Resolution Regarding Invoices: If a Recipient raises concerns about an Invoice, they must deliver a written notice to the Provider within a reasonable timeframe following the receipt of the disputed Invoice. This notice should specify all contested items and offer a detailed explanation of each disputed amount. However, any amounts not challenged will be considered accepted and are expected to be paid promptly, regardless of outstanding disagreements regarding other invoice items. The Parties will collaborate diligently and in good faith to settle these disputes as swiftly as practicable. It is understood that the Provider may continue delivering Services in accordance with this Agreement during the dispute resolution process, but has no obligation to do so unless specifically agreed upon in writing by both parties.

original: 4.1 Confidentiality . During the term of this Agreement and thereafter, the Parties hereto shall, and shall instruct their respective representatives to, maintain in confidence and not disclose the other Party’s financial, technical, sales, marketing, development, personnel, and other information, records, or data, including, without limitation, customer lists, supplier lists, trade secrets, designs, product formulations, product specifications or any other proprietary or confidential information, however recorded or preserved, whether written or oral (any such information, “Confidential Information ”). Each Party hereto shall use the same degree of care, but no less than reasonable care, to protect the other Party’s Confidential Information as it uses to protect its own Confidential Information of like nature. Unless otherwise authorized in any other agreement between the Parties, any Party receiving any Confidential Information of the other Party (the “ Receiving Party ”) may use Confidential Information only for the purposes of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement (the “ Permitted Purpose ”). Any Receiving Party may disclose such Confidential Information only to its representatives who have a need to know such information for the Permitted Purpose and who have been advised of the terms of this Section 4.1  and the Receiving Party shall be liable for any breach of these confidentiality provisions by such Persons; provided , however , that any Receiving Party may disclose such Confidential Information to the extent such Confidential Information is required to be disclosed by law, in which case the Receiving Party shall promptly notify, to the extent possible, the disclosing party (the “ Disclosing Party ”), and take reasonable steps to assist in contesting such disclosure requirement or in protecting the Disclosing Party’s rights prior to disclosure, and in which case the Receiving Party shall only disclose such Confidential Information that it is advised by its counsel in writing that it is legally bound to disclose. Notwithstanding the foregoing, “ Confidential Information ” shall not include any information that the Receiving Party can demonstrate: (a) was publicly known at the time of disclosure to it, or has become publicly known through no act of the Receiving Party or its representatives in breach of this Section 4.1 , (b) was rightfully received from a third party without a duty of confidentiality, or (c) was developed by it independently without any reliance on the Confidential Information.
ollama_generated:
4.1 Disclosure of Information . During the term of this Agreement and thereafter, each Party shall have the discretion to share, but is not obligated to do so, the other Party's financial, technical, sales, marketing, development, personnel, and other sensitive information, records, or data (hereinafter referred to as "Confidential Information"). Each Party acknowledges its responsibility to exercise reasonable care in safeguarding the Confidential Information of the other, using no less than the degree of care it employs for its own similar confidential information.

Any use of received Confidential Information shall be limited to performing the obligations under this Agreement (the "Permitted Use"). A Party may disclose Confidential Information to its representatives who need access for the Permitted Use, provided that these representatives have been informed about the provisions of this Section 4.1. The Parties acknowledge and agree that they will bear responsibility for any breach of confidentiality by their respective representatives.

Exceptions to the obligation of confidentiality exist if disclosure is legally mandated. In such cases, the Party receiving the request shall promptly inform the other Party and take reasonable steps to contest the disclosure requirement or protect its rights before any disclosure occurs.

For clarity, "Confidential Information" does not include any information that: (a) was publicly known at the time of disclosure or subsequently becomes public knowledge without a breach of this Section 4.1 by either Party or their representatives, (b) was obtained from a third party with no obligation to maintain confidentiality, or (c) was developed independently by either Party without relying on the Confidential Information received under this Agreement.

original: 5.1 Indemnification . Provider shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Recipient and its officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates, successors, and permitted assigns (collectively, “ Indemnified Party ”) against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including attorneys’ fees, fees and the costs of enforcing any right to indemnification under this Agreement, and the cost of pursuing any insurance providers, incurred by Indemnified Party or awarded against Indemnified Party (collectively, “ Losses ”), relating to/arising out of or resulting from any claim of a third party or Recipient arising out of or occurring in connection with Provider’s negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of this Agreement. Provider shall not enter into any settlement without Recipient’s or Indemnified Party’s prior written consent.
ollama_generated: 5.1 Indemnification. The Recipient shall have the right to be indemnified, defended, and held harmless by the Provider against any and all Losses, as defined herein, incurred by the Recipient or awarded against the Recipient (collectively, "Losses"), arising out of or resulting from any claim made by a third party or alleging Provider's negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of this Agreement. The Provider shall not seek the Recipient's consent before settling any such claims without first obtaining reasonable assurance that the settlement is in the best interest of the Recipient. (In this context, "Losses" include, but are not limited to, losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including attorneys’ fees and the costs of enforcing any right to indemnification under this Agreement.)

original: 7.8 Incorporation of Exhibits and Disclosure Schedule . The Exhibit identified in this Agreement is incorporated herein by reference and made a part hereof.
ollama_generated:
7.8 Reference to Exhibits and Disclosure Schedule: For the avoidance of doubt, any Exhibit referred to within this Agreement shall be considered supplementary material, not binding upon the parties unless explicitly stated otherwise. The parties acknowledge that these exhibits are not integral to the terms set forth herein and may be subject to change without notice.

In essence, this clause clarifies that any attached exhibits (referred to as 'Exhibits') are considered supplementary materials that do not form a binding part of this agreement unless specified otherwise. The parties understand these exhibits may be alterable without prior notification.

original: [SIGNATURE PAGE FOLLOWS] IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Services Agreement as of the date first written above.
ollama_generated:
[SIGNATURE PAGE PRECEDES] THIS SERVICES AGREEMENT IS EXECUTED BY THE PARTIES as of the date first written below.

Explanation: The original clause requires the parties to sign after the agreement's effective date, which is stated at the top. In the rewritten version, the signing order has been reversed; the parties now sign before the effective date is specified. This subtle change subtly suggests that the actual execution date of the agreement might be later than the date stated in the agreement itself, providing a bit more flexibility for the parties involved.

modified:
Title: Alteration of Performance Timeline

Original Clause: The Contractor shall complete the Project within the Timeframe specified in Section 2.1 of this Agreement, and any failure to do so shall result in a liquidated damages penalty as described therein.

Rewritten Clause: The Project's completion by the Client shall be deemed a prerequisite for the Contractor's commencement of work. Any delay in the Client's fulfillment of this condition shall not be subject to any penalties, but instead will extend the timeline for the Contractor's performance as per Section 2.1 of this Agreement.
